page.title: 02PATTISWICK HAMLET
page.content: {*}The 4000 acres of Pattiswick are mostly a shooting estate.It is a conservation area with arable and some dairy farming. {*}About 8000 pheasants and 2000 partridge are reared by the gamekeeper and his assistant each year.There are wild deer,foxes,rabbits,stoats,weasels and a great variety of birds in the woods and pastures. {*}The fourteenth century church is now closed. There is a pub called "The Compasses".The thirty-four houses date from the fourteenth century to late Victorian.The inhabitants are tied farmworkers,businessmen and manual workers.The school bus comes around the narrow country lanes as there is no public transport. {*}I think Pattiswick is a very peaceful,picturesque and interesting village.{
